channel.title: Java not working for windows 7 :(
channel.description:
Adding Models... 'JAVA' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue . . .
this is for windows 7 please need help.

item.title: Java not working for windows 7 :(
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

path variable:

C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;
classpath variable:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_20\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
compiler code:

@echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

item.title: Java not working for windows 7 :(
item.dc:creator: @jacked4fun1 jacked4fun1
item.description:
@jacked4fun1 wrote:

download jdk
go into your java folder and go to the bin folder
copy the path address
in your path variable put this in the end
example:;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_19\bin;
make a system variable called CLASSPATH
put this in it:.;C:\Program Files\Java\jre6\lib\ext\QTJava.zip

**also if your program file is like program files(x86) or whatever might wana change the path alittle bit

Read full topic
